comments:
I'm using Eclipse 3.1M4 and tested some of the new J2SE 5 language features. The
following Annotation sample code always result in an Internal Compile Error.
Compiling with javac works. Changing back the order to "min = 1, max = 3" also
works. After the occurred Compile Error, copy/cut/paste does not work anymore in
the file.

I have attached the source and the exception.

----Bug.java----
public class Bug {
    
    public @interface TestAnnotation {
        int min();
        int max();
    }
    
    @TestAnnotation(max = 3, min = 1)
    public Object o;

}

--------------------------

eclipse.buildId=I20041216-2000
java.version=1.5.0
java.vendor=Sun Microsystems Inc.
BootLoader constants: OS=win32, ARCH=x86, WS=win32, NL=de_DE
Command-line arguments:  -os win32 -ws win32 -arch x86
